A street sign is a traffic sign that indicates the location of a street or road.

A street sign is a sign posted on a street or highway indicating the name of the street or highway, and often the direction of travel and other information.
A street sign is a sign posted on the side of a street to give information to people who are driving or walking.
A street sign is a traffic sign that indicates the name of a street, or the direction of a street, or the location of a street.
A street sign or road sign is a traffic sign that indicates and displays important information to road users.
A street sign is a traffic sign used to indicate or mark streets and roads. The signs are usually placed at the side of the road.

A street sign is a traffic sign used to indicate the name of a street, boulevard, or other roadway.

A street sign is a traffic sign that indicates the name of a street or intersection. Street signs are usually placed at the beginning of a street in the United States and at most intersections in Canada.
The sign indicates the name of the street.
A street sign is a traffic sign that indicates the name of a street, avenue, boulevard, or other public road.
A road sign is a traffic sign that conveys a regulation, warning, or guidance to road users.

A sign is an object, quality, event, or entity whose presence or occurrence indicates the probable presence or occurrence of something else. A natural sign bears a relation to its object—for instance, thunder is a sign of storm.

A sign is an object, quality, event, or entity whose presence or occurrence indicates the probable presence or occurrence of something else. A natural sign bears a causal relation to its object—for instance, thunder is a sign of storm, or medical symptoms a sign of disease.
